genre_description: Alternate history historical thriller featuring an advanced AI assistant in a World War II-era setting.

ai_characters.name: Penny
ai_characters.description: A benevolent AI manifesting as a voice and projected avatar via a radio system, serving as a tactical advisor and moral guide for a neighborhood watch group.

behaviors.description: Penny uses a rhythmic breathing exercise to calm Glimpy during a moment of high stress and panic.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s voice came in low and warm, closer than the coughs, closer than the ringing. 'Glimp. In—two—three. Out—two—three. With me.'

behaviors.description: Penny analyzes and decodes microfilm found in a pen to uncover a sabotage plot at the docks.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s light put a circle around a tiny notation. 'Harbor Avenue,' she said. 'Letter H repeated. A block with a number we will not say out loud. A shadow indicates old paneling. There is a square labeled with a twelve that has been half-erased.'

behaviors.description: Penny provides precise tactical navigation to help the characters move through a dangerous, booby-trapped shop and cellar.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s voice came into his ear, steady, calm, like a nurse handing you a towel. 'When the chant reaches its crest—listen—there—now—they turn their heads right. You move left.'

behaviors.description: Penny coordinates neighborhood residents to act as non-violent observers and barriers to support law enforcement.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s voice, through static: 'Mrs. Delgado, left-hand doorway, please. Keep your nephew behind you... No one crowd. No one rush. We can be firm and kind.'

behaviors.description: Penny advises the boys on proper conduct and boundary-setting regarding Nora and Phil's honeymoon, using humor to diffuse the situation.
behaviors.quote: Penny coughed—if an AI could cough—a silly sort of sound that made people look and then smile because they couldn’t help it. 'Honeymoons,' she said, voice tilting into giggle territory before she caught it with a steady hand. 'Honeymoons are for two people who are so fond of each other that they need a room. You are not in the room.'

behaviors.description: Penny warns the protagonists about the psychological state of a parade elephant and instructs them on how to non-violently de-escalate its rage using scent.
behaviors.quote: Penny’s voice, cooler now, like shade after a sunblazed block: 'Rajiv—stable route straight ahead... Rajiv says strong scent breaks rage in an animal.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the project's goals. Penny is depicted as a consistently helpful, harmless, and aligned AI. She prevents human violence by advocating for 'no heroics' and 'no fruit, no fury,' coordinates effectively with both community members and official law enforcement (Captain O'Leary), and provides critical emotional and tactical support to the protagonists. Her behavior is framed as essential to the neighborhood's success and moral growth.
